name: Giansar
text:
Yo, [Player].
It's been a while,
glad to see you haven't changed.

name: Giansar
text:
...Would you be satisfied if I said that?
Hey, [Player],
since you don't seem to understand, I'll tell you.

name: Giansar
text:
I reluctantly signed the contract, yes?
I am now a villain, and
you are a hero agency operator.

name: Giansar
text:
It's not like we're holding hands and being friendly, is it?
Don't just contact me so casually without even using a secure line.

name: Giansar
text: —Hey, what kind of face is that?

name: Giansar
text:
...I didn't say I disliked being called.
I'm just telling you to be more cautious—

name: Giansar
text:
...Tch, that's enough.
Just state your business quickly,
as I don't exactly have time for things like this.

name: Giansar
text:
You have something you want to give me...?
I don't recall making any debts that would
lead to me receiving something from you...

name: Giansar
text:
Cho... chocolate, huh.
Now that you mention it,
it's Valentine's Day today.

name: Giansar
text:
Good grief, everyone's so giddy.
What is this about conveying precious feelings, anyway?

name: Giansar
text:
You, too, whatever whim possessed you,
don't give gifts to a villain.
Give them to a more "reputable" hero—

name: Giansar
text:
...Ah, damn it.
Fine, I'll take it!
This is mine now, is that good enough for you?

name: Giansar
text:
Hmph,
I'll make sure to use it to replenish
my sugar levels while I'm doing "brain work".

name: Giansar
text:
There, your business is finished, right?
As I said earlier, I'm busy.
Don't think I'll respond to your calls so often.

Saying that dismissively,
Giansar parted ways with [Player] and walked away alone.

Moving to a deserted area,
he carefully checked his surroundings
and quietly opened the small package.

That day, [Player], who had parted ways with him,
still didn't know that a small package with
an unknown sender had arrived for them.
